page.title: 15Farming - Nursery
page.content: The nursery has been open for 7 years and is an annex to the one in Rode Heath-a family firm for 3 generations. The nursery is on 7 acres of land and the main occupation is growing shrubs for the wholesale trade-garden centres and market traders.The most popular plants grown are Leylandii and small conifers. There are 6 plastic tunnels 56 and 80 ft. long and 1 net tunnel for the hardier plants. There is a water tank. Trees cannot be grown on the land because the areas is too windy. Most 'liners' or young plants are imported from Holland. Rhododendrons cannot be grown because the soil is too acid. No plant is kept longer than 2 years. Most are sold at 1 year and 18 month old. The nursery is involved in preparing plants for a Garden Festival to be held locally in October 1986.
